The Wuhan Institute of Virology received: 600,000 as part of a larger five-year U.S. government grant to a U.S.-based nonprofit studying emerging infectious diseases, not $7.5 million as claimed by President Donald Trump.
False claims circulated online that the: 3.7 million in National Institutes of Health (NIH) grant money. However, the NIH did not award such a grant. Instead, it gave a grant totaling $3.4 million to the U.S.-based EcoHealth Alliance to study the risk of future emergence of coronaviruses from bats. EcoHealth distributed $600,000 of that total to the Wuhan Institute of Virology.
The claim made by President Trump that h: ended" the funding is misleading, as the grant awarded to the Wuhan Institute of Virology was not terminated. There may be other funding sources included in the $7.5 million figure, but it is unclear what those sources are.
Fox News acknowledged that it is not cle: S. funding went directly to the Wuhan Institute of Virology due to its collaboration with other institutions on projects funded by American grants.
